channel.title: Anger Management Institute
channel.description: Quick Tips for Managing Anger is a show about how deal with anger effectively and practically. Lynette Hoy, Marriage and Family Counselor and Anger Management Specialist, presents insights and skills for managing anger. You can learn to change unhealthy anger into a positive force which accomplishes something good for yourself and others! No more yelling, swearing, manipulating or giving the 'cold shoulder'. Transform your anger into faith, assertiveness, problem-solving, empathy and forgiveness! Learn techniques for managing conflict, overcoming rage and developing healthy relationships!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Quick Tips for Managing Anger
channel.itunes:summary: Quick Tips for Managing Anger is a show about how deal with anger effectively and practically. Throughout the week Lynette Hoy, Marriage and Family Counselor and Anger Management Specialist, presents insights and skills for managing anger. You can learn to change unhealthy anger into a positive force which accomplishes something good for yourself and others! No more yelling, swearing, manipulating or giving the 'cold shoulder'. Train yourself to turn anger into faith, assertiveness, problem-solving, empathy and forgiveness! Learn techniques for managing conflict and developing healthy relationships!
channel.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC

item.title: Steps for Managing Anger
item.description: Anger is a strong emotion which can ruin your life. On the other hand, anger can be managed no matter what circumstances you face or skills you may be deficient. in. Here are some steps to help you really manage your anger and achieve healthy goals in life.
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com
item.itunes:subtitle: If you apply these skills - you can manage your anger!
item.itunes:summary: Learn how changing your self-talk, applying a time-out, communicating with empathy and assertiveness can help you control anger now!
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, conflict, anger management, managing anger, anger control, assertive, assertiveness, communication, aggression

item.title: When Love Turns to Anger
item.description: This Marriage 101 interview with Lynette Hoy, Anger Management Specialist, focuses on how couples can deal with the anger that is a normal part of every relationship.
item.author: Lynette J. Hoy, NCC, LCPC
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger unleashed can destroy a marriage. Learn healthy skills to work through conflict and make your relationship more satisfying.
item.itunes:summary: Lynette Hoy shares how anger can be a positive force for change in marriage when transformed into assertiveness, conflict management, empathy and forgiveness!
item.itunes:author: Lynette J. Hoy
item.itunes:keywords: anger, marriage, relationship, conflict, love, anger management

item.title: Anger and Divorce
item.description: The helplessness that results from divorce can trigger so much anger. The way you handle anger can be redirected into a positive force in your life. Divorce Today host, Stephanie McCracken discusses anger with Anger Management Counselor Lynette Hoy. Hoy's newest book, What's Good About Anger looks at the positive change that can be triggered by refocusing our anger.
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger - a normal reaction in divorce- can help move you towards healthy goals!
item.itunes:summary: Is anger an inevitable result of divorce? Or can refocusing anger during this crisis bring about positive change? The helplessness that comes from divorce can trigger the "control mechanism" of anger. Lynette Hoy, Anger Management Specialist teaches how to redirect anger into a positive force in your life and relationships.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy and Stephanie McCracken
item.itunes:keywords: anger, divorce, anger management, anger control, rage, resentment, forgive, stress

item.title: Anger in the Workplace
item.description: Today's program is about anger. Do you know someone whose angry behavior affects or threatens you, your colleagues or family members? Has this anger reached the point where legal problems arise or others threaten retaliation that might seriously disrupt a company's workforce in the form of reduction in motivation or productivity, high rates of employee turnover and absenteeism, or even workplace violence? Have your clients or customers complained or threatened to go elsewhere? Or is anger a feeling with which you struggle? Do you react to a situation rather than think it through? Do you find yourself stuck in your anger and blaming or punishing others for your pain? If these questions have resonance with you either at work or at home, this program might be of great interest. My guest is Lynette Hoy who specializes as an Anger Coach.
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger in the Workplace
item.itunes:summary: Do you know someone whose angry behavior threatens you, your colleagues or family members? Has this anger reached the point where legal problems arise or others threaten retaliation that might seriously disrupt a company's workforce in the form of reduction in motivation or productivity, high rates of employee turnover and absenteeism, or even workplace violence? Or is anger a feeling with which you struggle? Do you react to a situation rather than think it through? Do you find yourself stuck in your anger and blaming or punishing others for your pain? If these questions have resonance with you either at work or at home, this program might be of great interest. My guest is Lynette Hoy who specializes as an Anger Coach.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy and Milton Lopes
item.itunes:keywords: anger, anger management, anger control, rage, resentment, forgive

item.title: Angry Relationships!
item.description: Handling someone who is angry is tricky. Learn strategies for defusing someone else's anger.
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Here are strategies for defusing someone's anger with assertive communication.
item.itunes:summary: Anger and conflict can ruin relationships. Learn how anger management skills can actually improve your relationships.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, conflict, anger management, anger skills, managing anger, anger control, communication, relationship conflict

item.title: Anger Management Made Easy!
item.description: Here are 4 steps for overcoming problem anger. Discover how anger control is achievable no matter what circumstances you face or skills you may lack!
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com (Lynette Hoy)
item.itunes:subtitle: Here are 4 steps for overcoming problem anger.
item.itunes:summary: Discover how anger control is achievable no matter what circumstances you face or skills you may lack!
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, conflict, anger management, anger skills, managing anger, anger control, communication, aggression, conflict

item.title: Anger Hurts Kids!
item.description: Children from homes characterized by anger and conflict are more likely to develop problems in school, relationships, with drugs and the law. Consider the harmful consequences and first steps that parents can change in Part One of this series.
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Children from homes characterized by anger and conflict will suffer ill-effects.
item.itunes:summary: They are more likely to develop problems in school, relationships, with drugs and with the law. Consider the harmful consequences and first steps to change in Part One of this series.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, conflict, anger management, children, managing anger, anger control, communication, aggression, family conflict

item.title: Say No to Angry Clashes!
item.description:
Anger and conflict often go hand-in-hand. Here are some practical ways to manage conflict and prevent angry clashes.
Today's techniques will help you manage relationship conflicts. Learn how to sum-up what people say and then, how to communicate your need and viewpoint assertively. These skills will help you effectively work through conflict and manage anger in relationships!
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger and conflict often go hand-in-hand. Here are some practical ways to manage conflict and prevent angry clashes.
item.itunes:summary: Today's techniques will help you manage relationship conflicts. Learn how to sum-up what people say to you and then, how to communicate your need and viewpoint assertively. These skills are the basis for effectively working through conflict and managing anger in relationships!
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, conflict, anger management, managing anger, anger control, assertive, assertiveness, communication, aggression

item.title: Make Anger Work for You!
item.description: Discover how to make anger work for you rather than against you. Today's techniques will help you stop the negative consequences of anger and teach you to strategically express anger and needs tactfully, solve problems and build healthy relationships!
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Discover how to make anger work for you rather than against you.
item.itunes:summary: Today's techniques will help you stop negative ways of handling anger like - stuffing it, exploding or using manipulation. Learn to strategically express your anger and needs, solve problems and build healthy relationships!
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, manipulate, anger management, managing anger, anger control, conflict, assertive, aggression

item.title: Intoxicating Anger!
item.description: Anger can be a habit we can't kick. Anger often keeps us from feeling anything else! When you are intoxicated with anger - you don't really get what you want in life. Here are some steps to help you discover how anger can be a good force in your life!
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Do you like anger or think you just can't get over it?
item.itunes:summary: Anger can seem like a habit we can't kick. Anger keeps us from feeling anything else! When you are intoxicated with anger - you don't really get what you want in life. Here are some steps to help you discover how to make anger an ally!
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, forgiveness, guilt, guilty, anger management, managing anger, anger control, conflict, assertive. forgive

item.title: The Guilty & The Angry!
item.description: Why is it that when you feel anger - you feel guilty? Isn't anger normal? Can't anger be a good thing? Still the feeling of anger generally results in feelings of guilt. Here's a way to check out whether your guilt over anger is true or false.
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger and guilt often go hand-in-hand. Find out whether your guilt is true or false!
item.itunes:summary: Why is it that when you feel anger - you feel guilty? Isn't anger normal? Can't anger be a good thing? Still the feeling of anger generally results in feelings of guilt. Here's a way to check out whether your guilt over anger is true or false.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, forgiveness, guilt, guilty, anger management, managing anger, anger control, conflict, assertive. forgive

item.title: Talk-Out Your Anger!
item.description: Anger is an emotion which needs to be expressed. Most people tend to hold anger in or explode. Some use manipulation. Learn how to assertively express your anger and get your needs met without squashing others.
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger is an emotion which needs to be expressed.
item.itunes:summary: Most people tend to hold anger in or explode. Some use manipulation. Learn some no-guilt techniques to assertively express your anger and get your needs met without squashing others.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, forgiveness, assertiveness, anger management, managing anger, anger control, conflict, assertive. forgive

item.title: The Anger-Trust Connection
item.description: How can you rebuild trust when you are angry with someone? Is there any hope? What needs to happen to break the cycle of anger and distrust? Here are some insights and tips for restoring broken relationships with your spouse or significant other when trust has been violated.
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger easily blocks the trust so vital to intimate relationships.
item.itunes:summary: How can you rebuild trust when you are angry with someone? Is there any hope? What needs to happen to break the cycle of anger and distrust? Here are some insights and tips for restoring broken relationships when your spouse or significant other lets you down.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, forgiveness, trust, distrust, anger management, managing anger, anger control, conflict, forgive

item.title: Is it Anger or Abuse?
item.description: How do you know when someone is just angry or is being abusive? Here are some insights to help you recognize anger and how domestic abuse and battering differs.
item.author: counselor@hoyweb.com
item.itunes:subtitle: You should be informed on the differences between anger and abuse and what to do.
item.itunes:summary: How do you know when someone is just angry or is being abusive? Here are some insights to help you recognize anger and how abuse and battering are so different.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, abuse, domestic violence, anger management, managing anger, anger control, violence, conflict, rage

item.title: Talk Yourself Out of Anger!
item.description: Its hard to believe that what you say to yourself can actually trigger and escalate your anger! Learn how to defuse anger through some simple self-talk messages!
item.itunes:subtitle: Change your anger by changing what you say to yourself!
item.itunes:summary: It's hard to believe that what you say to yourself can actually trigger and escalate your anger! Learn how to defuse anger through some simple self-talk messages!

item.itunes:keywords: anger, anger management, managing anger, anger control, violence, conflict, forgiveness, rage

item.title: Anger's Ugly Consequences
item.description: The consequences of anger can be very costly. Broken relationships. Legal problems. Job loss. You can prevent negative consequences by learning to manage your anger. Here are some insights to help you commit to change anger for good!
item.itunes:subtitle: What have you lost because of your anger? Here are the first steps to real change.
item.itunes:summary: The consequences of anger can be very costly. Broken relationships. Legal problems. Job loss. You can prevent negative consequences by learning to manage your anger. Here are some insights to help you commit to change anger for good!
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, anger management, managing anger, forgive, anger control, violence, conflict, rage

item.title: When Love Gets Angry
item.description: Why do lovers hurt each other so easily? Learn about some of the issues which can cause anger in loving relationships and how to take steps to love your partner more deeply.
item.itunes:subtitle: Discover why there is so much anger in love.
item.itunes:summary: Why do lovers hurt each other so easily? Learn about some of the issues which can cause anger in loving relationships and how to take steps to love your partner more deeply.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, anger management, managing anger, mad, forgive, love, anger control, conflict, forgiveness, forgiving, rage

item.title: Anger, Forgiveness and Consequences
item.description: What if someone continues to abuse or disrespect you? How can you let anger go and be free of resentment towards those who have hurt you so badly? This episode covers how to forgive and how relationships may need to change despite forgiveness.
item.itunes:subtitle: Does forgiving mean there are no consequences for people who offend you?
item.itunes:summary: What if someone continues to abuse or disrespect you? How can you let anger go and be free of resentment towards those who have hurt you so badly? This episode covers how to forgive and how relationships may need to change despite forgiveness.

item.itunes:keywords: anger, anger management, managing anger, mad, forgive, anger control, violence, conflict, forgiveness, forgiving, rage

item.title: 4 Q's to Disarming Anger
item.description: Anger and conflict is widespread resulting in negative emotional, mental, relational and spiritual consequences. Here are four questions to move you out of the pit of anger and break the destructive patterns that often lead to broken relationships and violence.
item.itunes:subtitle: What can you do to stop harmful anger and it's consequences? Here are some helpful questions and tips to disarm harmful anger, develop self-control and build relationships!
item.itunes:summary: Anger and conflict is widespread resulting in negative emotional, mental, relational and spiritual consequences. Here are four questions to move you out of the pit of anger and break the destructive patterns that often lead to broken relationships and violence.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, anger management, managing anger, anger control, conflict

item.title: Growing Up with Anger and Violence
item.description: Anger and conflict in the home is widespread and causes negative emotional, mental and spiritual consequences. How can you be a change agent and help break the pattern that often leads to violence?
item.itunes:subtitle: Children who grow up in angry and violent homes will experience ill-effects. Learn how to help and bring healing.
item.itunes:summary: Anger and conflict in the home is widespread and causes negative emotional, mental and spiritual consequences. How can you be a change agent and help break the pattern that often leads to violence?
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, anger management, managing anger, violence, rage, abuse

item.title: Victim of Anger?
item.description: Anger can be an overwhelming emotion that makes us feel like we have no control over it. Discover tools which will empower you to cope with stress and anger in healthy and effective ways.
item.itunes:subtitle: Do you feel like a victim of your own anger? Learn helpful tools for escaping the trap of stress and anger.

item.title: Why Get Mad Over Things that Don't Matter?
item.description: Here's a look at what contributes to anger and how to overcome the tendency to get mad over insignificant issues.
item.itunes:subtitle: Explore how to prevent the tendency to overreact with anger!
item.itunes:summary: Here's a look at what contributes to anger and how to overcome the tendency to get mad over insignificant issues.

item.itunes:keywords: anger, anger management, managing anger, mad, forgive,rage, anger control, controlling anger

item.title: The Ultimate Antidote for Anger
item.description: Forgiveness is the only way to resolve anger. Forgiveness is a difficult topic because it calls us as human beings to a higher standard of grace and mercy. But when we don't forgive we run into a greater human dilemma: that of unforgiveness which keeps the fires of anger burning.
item.itunes:subtitle: Discover the complete anger antidote through forgiveness!
item.itunes:summary: Forgiveness is the only way to resolve anger. Forgiveness is a difficult topic because it calls us as human beings to a higher standard of grace and mercy. But when we don't forgive we run into a greater human dilemma: that of unforgiveness which keeps the fires of anger burning.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC, Anger Management Specialist
item.itunes:keywords: anger, anger management, managing anger, forgive, forgiveness, forgiving, anger control

item.title: Is Anger Always Sinful?
item.description: Most religious people believe anger is wrong. Many don't act on their anger when injustice is taking place. Learn what it means to 'be angry and not sin'.
item.itunes:subtitle: Discover when anger is wrong and when anger is necessary to bring about change!
item.itunes:summary: Most religious people believe anger is wrong. Many don't act on their anger when injustice is taking place. Learn what it means to 'be angry and not sin'.
item.itunes:author: Lynette Hoy, NCC, LCPC and Dr. Ray Pritchard
